page.title: 12AIR MUSEUM BAGINTON
page.content: In 1967 a group of enthusiastic volun teers acquired 3 acres purchasing a further 4 acres from Coventry Council.The ever expanding collection now open to the public displays military and civilian aircraft dated between 1936 and 1958 and includes the only surviving Flettner F1 282 Kolibri helicopter and the only Boulton Paul P111A ever built.Later additions were purchased or donated by the Ministry of Defence and organisations like the American Airforce.Although essentially concerned with aircraft examples of associated equipment include a lighting tower, a 25 pounder field gun once used by the Desert Rats in World War 2 and a Bofors Anti-Aircraft gun.
